com.camerontec.catalys.core.session

Class SessionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.SessionFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISessionFactory, INotifySupport, Iterable<Session>

    public final class SessionFactory
extends Object
implements ISessionFactory, INotifySupport
    Default implementation of ISessionFactory based on IConnectionPointConfiguration.

    Fires NewSessionEvent.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SessionFactory.ConfigurationReferencesAccessor
      This class is simply used to allow the SessionCommandLineProcessor to lookup the values of these references.

      • continueSession

        public Session continueSession(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint,
                               Connection connection)
        Returns a Session which can be used to continue a pre-existing Session at the given connection point.

        The Session uses the given Connection which should be started.
        The Session itself is not started.

        Specified by:
        continueSession in interface ISessionFactory
        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - Connection point at which we want to start communication.
        connection - Active connection over which we will communicate.
        Returns:
        Session ready to be started. Null if no session is known for this connection point. @ * if there is a problem communicating with the factory.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - If there is a problem associating connection with a session

      • findSession

        public Session findSession(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        Returns the Session associated with the given connection point, if any.
        Specified by:
        findSession in interface ISessionFactory
        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - The connection point.
        Returns:
        Session associated with connection point. Null if none.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if there is a problem cloning a session.

      • removeSession

        public void removeSession(Session session)
        Removes the given session from the list of sessions known to the factory.

        Note:
        Normally for internal use only.
        Application programs will not normally need to call this.

        Parameters:
        session - The session to remove.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(EventListener listener,
                        boolean removeOnException)
        Description copied from interface: INotifySupport
        Register given listener.

        If the listener throws an exception when it is notified, it will be automatically removed if removeOnException is true.

        Specified by:
        addListener in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener
        removeOnException - whether to remove the listener after it throws an exception

      • fireNotify

        public List<ListenerExceptionEntry> fireNotify(EventObject event)
        Description copied from interface: INotifySupport
        Equivalent to fireNotify( event, 0 );
        Specified by:
        fireNotify in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be sent to listeners.
        Returns:
        List of any ListenerExceptionEntry recording the exceptions that occurred notifying listeners. Null if none.
        See Also:
        INotifySupport.fireNotify(EventObject, int )

      • fireNotify

        public List<ListenerExceptionEntry> fireNotify(EventObject event,
                                               int minListeners)
        Description copied from interface: INotifySupport
        Sends event to all listeners.

        If the event was sent to fewer than minListeners then that will be regarded as an error. In that case, a non null list will be returned containing an appropriate ListenerExceptionEntry.

        If a listener throws an exception when it is notified, that exception is returned in a List (because there may be more than one listener, we may need to return more than one Exception).
        If a listener's removeOnException attribute is true, then if that listener throws an exception it will automatically be removed.

        Specified by:
        fireNotify in interface INotifySupport
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be sent to listeners.
        minListeners - Minimum number of listeners.
        Returns:
        List of any ListenerExceptionEntry recording the exceptions that occurred notifying listeners. Null if none.
